descript.abstract: This dataset contains point features that represent Railroad Crossings in Central Ohio. Each highway-rail or pathway crossing is assigned a unique alphanumeric seven digit identifier by the Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) and the United States Department of Transportation (USDOT) as a part of the Rail Safety Improvement Act of 2008. This unique identifier is stored in a national database that can be used to quickly retrieve information about the physical and operating characteristics of both public and private crossings. In addition, this information can be used by Emergency Personnel to quickly and accurately locate calls for service. This unique identifier is commonly referred to as a "Railroad Crossing ID" or "FRA Number". Each Railroad Crossing must have this number posted on a metal plate at each crossing. Many crossings have a sign that includes the name of the railroad and an emergency contact telephone number in addition to the Railroad Crossing ID.This information can be retrieved remotely from the Federal Railroad Administration, Office of Safety Analysis' website at: http://safetydata.fra.dot.gov/OfficeofSafety/PublicSite/Crossing/Crossing.aspx
descript.purpose: This dataset contains point features that represent the locations of Railroad Crossings in Central Ohio.

idinfo.useconst: This data is dedicated to the public domain under the Creative Commons Universal License (CC0).

cntorgp.cntorg: City of Columbus Department of Technology

idinfo.datacred: City of Columbus, Department of Public Safety, Division of Police United States Department of Transportation (USDOT) Federal Railroad Administration, Office of Safety Analysis (FRA)
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1.4959

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Seven digit alphanumeric unique identifier beginning with six characters and ending with a single digit number
attr.attrdefs: Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) Office of Safety Analysis

attr.attrdef: The name of the County that the Railroad Crossing is located in.
attr.attrdefs: City of Columbus, Department of Public Safety, Division of Police

attr.attrdef: The name of the Railroad responsible for the Railroad Crossing.
attr.attrdefs: City of Columbus Department of Public Safety Division of Police Communications Bureau GIS Section

attr.attrdef: The name of the highway or pathway that the Railroad crosses if available.
attr.attrdefs: City of Columbus Department of Public Safety Division of Police

attr.attrdef: A post or sign along each mile of a railroad track identifying and marking the distance from the actual or nominal start of a line which is usually the principal terminus or juniction with a more major line.

The specific website address for the Railroad Crossing that contains the following information: Location and Classification Information, Picture(s) of the railroad crossing, Site Information, Railroad Information, Warning Devices, Traffic, Highway, and Site Sketches.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
